image.altText: A mining truck at dusk

props.synopsis: The collapse of a Queensland coal mining company could signal wider problems for the industry as costs increase and commodity prices drop, according to an analyst.

title.children: More than 100 workers lose jobs as Queensland coal mine goes into administration

image.altText: arm of detective sifting through pile of wedding dresses on floor

props.synopsis: Queensland police say a 53-year-old Beaudesert woman defrauded customers by on-selling previous clients' wedding dresses in either their original form or by altering them for re-sale.

title.children: Police arrest woman over alleged wedding dress Ponzi scheme worth more than $100,000 and affecting 70 brides

image.altText: An aerial photo of a destroyed plane on the ground

props.synopsis: A transcript of communication between air traffic control and two aircraft that collided and burst into flames at Tokyo’s Haneda Airport sheds some light on how the incident unfolded. Here's what it says.

title.children: Air traffic control transcript suggests only one plane had permission to be on runway before deadly Japan collision

image.altText: Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein sit in grass with a golden retriever between them

props.synopsis: Most of the men mentioned in the unsealed documents have already been named in public as having met Jeffrey Epstein, and all deny knowing about his sex trafficking ring.

title.children: We read the Jeffrey Epstein documents so you don't have to. Here's what we found

image.altText: More revelations in the Jeffrey Epstein investigation

props.synopsis: A US court is releasing the names of dozens of people with ties to deceased financier Jeffrey Epstein a move that could reveal new details about his sex trafficking.

title.children: Names of Jeffrey Epstein's associates released in court documents spanning more than 900 pages

image.altText: University of Queensland animal expert Dr Christina Zdenek

props.synopsis: Snakes, crocodiles, cane toads, crown-of-thorns starfish and venomous jellyfish are among creatures on the move in the wake of heavy rainfall in Queensland.

title.children: Queensland rain brings out all creatures great and small as water displaces crocodiles, snakes

image.altText: Woman hands over Australian money to a man.

props.synopsis: Would you spend close to $30,000 for a chance to rub shoulders with those in charge of WA? Those with cash to splash have been doing just that — and many donations can remain hidden due to a legal loophole.

title.children: The millions in 'dark money' fuelling WA politics

image.altText: David Warner waves to the crowd and looks disappointed

props.synopsis: David Warner arrived at the SCG with designs on one final shining moment to cap a career, but on day two in Sydney that dream might have been taken away from him.

title.children: David Warner's grand farewell is not going to plan

image.altText: Australia batter David Warner ducks and watches a ball go behind him at the SCG.

props.synopsis: David Warner failed to convert a start to secure a fairytail finale, while Pakistan shelled another basic slips catch. Here's the five quick hits from day two of the Sydney Test at the SCG.

title.children: Five quick hits — Khawaja continues a troubling trend and the Sydney weather maintains another

image.altText: Uniformed army personnel discuss plans while standing near a defence truck

props.synopsis: More than 6,000 homes and businesses are still without power more than a week after powerful Christmas holiday storms ripped through Queensland's south-east.

title.children: Power poles 'snapped in half', network 'obliterated': Thousands still in the dark in Queensland's south-east

image.altText: A man in a suit sits next to a blonde woman

props.synopsis: The maverick independent MP says the government needs to support his demands for mandatory CCTV in abattoirs and a cessation on AFL projects until the Macquarie Point stadium passes parliament.

title.children: Tasmanian MP John Tucker threatens to 'bring the government down' over CCTV in abattoirs, AFL deals

image.altText: red chicken eyeballs camera

props.synopsis: When a trailer of hens overturned on a NSW highway, it was up to the RFS and two animal lovers to rescue them, dodging B-double trucks and crawling through thick undergrowth.

title.children: 100 chickens stranded on motorway median strip couldn't cross the road — until the community came to their rescue

image.altText: A video still of a man jumping over a judge's bench in a US court

props.synopsis: Video shows a defendant in a felony battery case sparking a brawl inside a Las Vegas courtroom after leaping both the defence table and the judge's bench, to attack a district court judge.

title.children: US judge attacked by defendant in courtroom scene captured on video

image.altText: Two men hugging

props.synopsis: Israel is refusing to take responsibility for the drone strike that killed Hamas kingpin Saleh al-Arouri, but his death does follow a vow from Israeli officials to hunt down those involved in the October 7 attack.

title.children: A Hamas leader thought he was safe. His death may suggest a global assassination campaign is underway

image.altText: A low angle view of the outside fence of Elmore Correctional Facility at daytime

props.synopsis: Plans to execute a convicted murderer by asphyxiating him with nitrogen may amount to "cruel, inhuman or degrading treatment" or even torture, experts say.

title.children: 'A painful and humiliating death': UN experts call for first US execution by nitrogen gas to be halted

image.altText: A woman with black hair in a white blazer speaks with her hands.

props.synopsis: The former 90210 actor has shared an update about her treatment journey after the cancer spread to her bones in November.

title.children: Actor Shannen Doherty hopes for 'three to five more years' after stage 4 cancer diagnosis

image.altText: A man draped in a Ukranian flag hugs a man in army fatigues among other released prisoners of war

props.synopsis: Russia's Defence Ministry says 248 military personnel were handed over by Ukraine and Kyiv said it had brought home 224 soldiers and six civilians in the largest documented swap of troops in the conflict so far.

title.children: Russia and Ukraine exchange hundreds of prisoners of war

image.altText: A prince and princess wave to the crowd

props.synopsis: Mary Donaldson sought out a deportment course in Sydney's Darlinghurst soon after meeting Denmark's Crown Prince Frederik in Sydney, to "transform her life".

title.children: How Princess Mary trained at a Sydney deportment school to become the future queen of Denmark

image.altText: Alice Springs township as seen from Anzac Hill.

props.synopsis: Police call for information about a black Ford Ranger they say can help "find the perpetrators" after a dead body was found on a remote road near Alice Springs on Monday.

title.children: Police searching for 'perpetrators', seize vehicle in suspicious death of 19yo man near Alice Springs

image.altText: An elderly woman lies in a hospital bed

props.synopsis: Raelene McEllister, 82, says she is afraid to return to her Alice Springs home after it was plundered on Boxing Day while she was in emergency surgery. She is among residents calling for further action on crime.

title.children: Thieves ransack house of elderly woman in surgery amid calls to tackle Alice Springs' 'out of control' summer crime rate

image.altText: Andrew and Nicola stand side by side on the Perth foreshore

props.synopsis: After slowly increasing their stake in Australian Agricultural Company for the past three years, the mining magnates' shareholding increased to 19.5 per cent this week — just under the takeover threshold of 20pc.

title.children: Billionaires Andrew 'Twiggy' and Nicola Forrest increase stake in Australia's largest cattle company

image.altText: Alex de Minaur stretches for a backhand at the United Cup.

props.synopsis: Twelve months on from a harrowing loss to Novak Djokovic, Alex de Minaur is riding a wave of confidence after beating the world number one for the first time in his career.

title.children: De Minaur goes from embarrassment to ecstasy after defeating Djokovic

image.altText: A man clenches his fist while in the air while holding a tennis racquet in the other hand.

props.synopsis: The world number 71 wins a fluctuating three-setter against Tomas Machac to join at least two other Australian men in the Brisbane International quarter-finals.

title.children: Rinky Hijikata becomes third Australian to make it through to Brisbane International quarter-finals

image.altText: Pedro Arroyo with hip hop artist Royal El Latino

props.synopsis: He's been stabbed twice, shot at, and had to defuse wild brawls. But while Brisbane-based Pedro Arroyo's career has not been all smiles, there have been plenty of "amazing" experiences.

title.children: Security guard to stars lists Foo Fighters, Bon Jovi, Ed Sheeran among favourites to visit Queensland

image.altText: Man walking past fallen power pole

props.synopsis: Nearly three weeks after ex-Tropical Cyclone Jasper crossed the coast, one community is still without basic amenities and another is completely cut off by road, prompting calls for help from the Australian Defence Force.

title.children: 'They're broken': Flood-ravaged Far North Queenslanders remain stranded, without power, water

image.altText: Lightning strike near home roofs in Blue Mountains

props.synopsis: It's understood the group were holding onto a metal railing when the storm hit "almost without warning".

title.children: Blue Mountains tourists struck by lightning in storm that came 'almost without warning'

image.altText: Michaela Windsor: OzHarvest Queensland State Manger, Michaela Windsor

props.synopsis: Australia's leading food rescue organisation says it's facing unprecedented demand in Queensland due to cost of living pressures.

title.children: As the cost-of-living crisis bites, charities are seeing a 'new cohort coming through'

image.altText: The lights on top of a police car in an Adelaide street.

props.synopsis: An internal investigation has been launched by SA Police after a photo of a partially naked woman in custody was uploaded to a police database.

title.children: SA Police investigate after mugshot of partially naked woman was uploaded to database

image.altText: An ambulance driving past the Royal Adelaide Hospital

props.synopsis: The SA Ambulance Service in launching a review after a 54-year-old man died waiting 10 hours for an ambulance in Adelaide's eastern suburbs.

title.children: SA man dies waiting 10 hours for an ambulance in day of 'significant' hospital ramping

image.altText: black and white picture of man with barbed fence and prison cell behind

props.synopsis: Dean Williams was excited to be released from prison, but then he was filled with fear from the pressures of life on the outside.

title.children: In the days before his release from prison, Dean had a lot of questions swirling in his head
